title: globalwindatlas
code: # install.packages("geodata") library(globalwindatlas) library(terra) #> terra 1.7.29 library(sf) #> Linking to GEOS 3.11.2, GDAL 3.6.2, PROJ 9.2.0; sf_use_s2() is TRUE library(ggplot2)

title: globalwindatlas
code: ## set directory for downloaded files, also will be used for quick files access set_gwa_dir("data/gwa") ## download wind capacity factors for wind-class #1 # get_wind_capacity_factor("BGD", IEC = 1) get_wind_capacity_factor("BGD", IEC = 2) # wind-class #2 #> [1] "data/gwa/BGD_capacity_factor_IEC2.tif" # get_wind_capacity_factor("BGD", IEC = 3) # wind-class #3  ## download wind speed data get_wind_speed("BGD", height = 100) #> [1] "data/gwa/BGD_wind_speed_100.tif" # get_wind_speed("BGD", height = 150) # get_wind_speed("BGD", height = 200)  # select data to plot obj <- get_wind_capacity_factor("BGD", IEC = 2)  ## plot  tr <- rast(obj) plot(tr, main = "Wind capacity factors") summary(tr) #> Warning: [summary] used a sample #>  BGD_capacity_factor_IEC2 #>  Min.   :0.01             #>  1st Qu.:0.15             #>  Median :0.19             #>  Mean   :0.20             #>  3rd Qu.:0.25             #>  Max.   :0.41             #>  NA's   :49764

what: Filter and group locations by capacity factor
title: globalwindatlas
code: gwa_tif <- get_wind_capacity_factor("BGD", IEC = 2) # wind-class #2  ## plot  # gwa_rast <- rast(gwa_tif) # plot(gwa_rast, main = "Wind capacity factors")  gwa_iec2_sf <- gwa_group_locations(gwa_tif,                                     # gis_sf,                                    int = seq(0, 1, by = .1),                                     # ID = "reg_off",                                    verbose = F, plot_process = F) #> Warning: [] empty SpatVector # library(ggplot2) ggplot(gwa_iec2_sf) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = eq), color = NA) +   # geom_sf(color = "grey", fill = NA, data = gis$voronoi$sf) +   scale_fill_viridis_d(option = "H", direction = 1, name = "CF") +   theme_bw()

title: Authors and Citation

text: Lugovoy O (2023). globalwindatlas: Access high-resolution (250m) wind potential data GIS/tif GlobalWindAtlas.info. R package version 2023.05.22.900.
code: @Manual{,   title = {globalwindatlas: Access high-resolution (250m) wind potential data in GIS/tif from GlobalWindAtlas.info},   author = {Oleg Lugovoy},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 2023.05.22.900}, }

what: Access high-resolution (250m) wind potential data in GIS/tif from GlobalWindAtlas.info
title: Access high-resolution (250m) wind potential data in GIS/tif from GlobalWindAtlas.info
text: package assists downloading processing high-resolution (250m grid) maps averaged wind potential Global Wind Atlas. data can used selections locations potential development wind power plants.

title: Access high-resolution (250m) wind potential data in GIS/tif from GlobalWindAtlas.info
text: can install development version globalwindatlas GitHub :

title: Access high-resolution (250m) wind potential data in GIS/tif from GlobalWindAtlas.info
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(globalwindatlas) ## set directory for downloaded files, also will be used for quick files access set_gwa_dir("data/gwa") ## download wind capacity factors for wind-class #1 get_wind_capacity_factor("ISL", IEC = 1) ## download wind speed data ISL <- get_wind_speed("ISL", height = 100) # Iceland ISL  MAR <- get_wind_speed("MAR", height = 100) # Morocco MAR <- get_wind_speed("MAR", height = 150) # Morocco  ## plot data library(terra) tr <- rast(MAR) plot(tr) plot(rast(ISL))

title: Access high-resolution (250m) wind potential data in GIS/tif from GlobalWindAtlas.info

what: Download wind capacity factors for a country — get_wind_capacity_factor

Download wind capacity factors for a country — get_wind_capacity_factor
code: get_wind_capacity_factor(   country,   IEC = 2,   path = get_gwa_dir(),   filename = NULL,   overwrite = FALSE )

title: Download wind capacity factors for a country — get_wind_capacity_factor
text: country isocode (three letters) country (case sensitive) IEC wind class (1, 2, 3) according International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC) path optional path directory saving downloaded file filename optional file-name overwrite logical, file overwritten exists

title: Group locations by intervals of values in given tiff-file and return geometries of the groups. — gwa_group_locations
code: gwa_group_locations(   gwa_tif,   gis_sf = NULL,   by_feature = TRUE,   ID = NULL,   int = seq(0, 1, by = 0.2),   simplify = T,   buffer = T,   drop_crumps = T,   verbose = T,   plot_process = T )

title: Group locations by intervals of values in given tiff-file and return geometries of the groups. — gwa_group_locations
text: gwa_tif tiff-file (terra-object) gis_sf optional sf object (map) crop gwa-tif by_feature logical, grouping done geometry (row sf-object), TRUE default (recommended large objects), FALSE geometries merged one. ID character, identification column sf-object. provided, geometries merged IDs. int numeric, intervals values simplify logical, TRUE, geometries simplified. buffer logical, TRUE, buffers added geometries. drop_crumps logical, TRUE, small geometries dropped. verbose logical, process reported. plot_process logical, plot process creation geometries.

title: Group locations by intervals of values in given tiff-file and return geometries of the groups. — gwa_group_locations
text: sf object geometries group, defined intervals.
